additional-note: The New York Herald and the New York Tribune merged into one newspaper beginning on March 19, 1924. The combined newspaper was initially published under the twin titles 'New York Herald' and 'New York Tribune' before changing to the single title 'New York Herald Tribune' on May 31, 1926.)
